title: Alan Jarrott
text:
Alan Jarrott (born 17 August 1956) is a former <a href="Australian%20rules%20football">Australian rules football</a>er who played with the <a href="North%20Melbourne%20Football%20Club">North Melbourne Football Club</a> and <a href="Melbourne%20Football%20Club">Melbourne Football Club</a> in the <a href="Australian%20Football%20League">Victorian Football League</a> (VFL).
Jarrott, who came from Mohyu in rural Victoria, was used as a half back flanker and ruck-rover during his career. He made his debut in the 17th round of the <a href="1977%20VFL%20season">1977 VFL season</a> and kept his place in the side until the <a href="preliminary%20final">preliminary final</a>, when he was dropped. As a result, he missed out on participating in North Melbourne's second VFL premiership. He played a semi final in 1978 but again was dropped and missed another grand final.
Noted for his accurate handballing skills, he won the handball competition on the TV show "<a href="World%20of%20Sport%20%28Australian%20TV%20series%29">World of Sport</a>" three times.
Alan is currently the coach of the Purple Knights in the Victorian Social Football League.
